diseases.name: Cholera
diseases.description: Cholera is an infectious disease that causes severe watery diarrhea, which can lead to dehydration and even death if untreated.

icd10.A00.0: Cholera due to Vibrio cholerae 01, biovar cholerae
icd10.A00.1: Cholera due to Vibrio cholerae 01, biovar eltor

diseases.name: Typhoid and Paratyphoid Fevers
diseases.description: Typhoid and paratyphoid fevers are bacterial infections caused by Salmonella typhi and Salmonella paratyphi, respectively.

diseases.name: Other Salmonella Infections
diseases.description: Other salmonella infections include various diseases caused by different strains of Salmonella bacteria.

diseases.name: Shigellosis
diseases.description: Shigellosis, also known as bacillary dysentery, is an infectious disease caused by a group of bacteria called Shigella.

diseases.name: Other Bacterial Intestinal Infections
diseases.description: This category includes various bacterial infections that affect the intestines.

diseases.name: Other Bacterial Foodborne Intoxications
diseases.description: These are bacterial infections caused by consuming contaminated food or water.

diseases.name: Amoebiasis
diseases.description: Amoebiasis is an infection caused by the amoeba Entamoeba histolytica.

diseases.name: Other Protozoal Intestinal Diseases
diseases.description: These are intestinal diseases caused by various protozoa.
